generalInfo: Embark on an unforgettable journey through Korea's rich cultural tapestry and awe-inspiring landscapes. Discover ancient capitals, UNESCO World Heritage sites, and vibrant cities. From the royal tombs and tranquil temples to dynamic urban experiences and breathtaking national parks, this adventure promises a blend of cultural immersion and natural splendour.

dayInfo.description: Seoul - Jeonju, South Korea: Ancient Kingdoms & Timeless Traditions Morning Departure from Seoul Begin your adventure by meeting your guide at the Donghwa Duty Free Shop Building parking lot near Gwanghwamun Intersection in Seoul. Depart from the bustling city and head southwest to Gongju, approximately 130 kilometers away (around 1.5 hours). Step into History at Royal Tombs and Fortresses Upon arrival in Gongju, explore the captivating UNESCO-listed Tomb of King Muryeong, a resting place filled with ancient artifacts and impressive burial treasures from the Baekje Kingdom era. Next, wander through the magnificent Gongsanseong Fortress, another UNESCO World Heritage site perched atop hills that offer panoramic views and fascinating historic insights into Korean ancient kingdoms. Journey to Scenic Buyeo and Legendary Cliffs Continue your historical exploration towards Buyeo (around 1.5-hour drive), the ancient capital famed for its stunning scenery. Stand atop the legendary Nakhwaam Cliff Observatory, a dramatic spot overlooking the tranquil river below. Let your imagination relive the poignant history; it was from this very cliff that 3,000 loyal Baekje court ladies bravely leaped to their tragic fate, choosing honor over surrender in the kingdom’s final moments. Immerse Yourself in Jeonju's Authentic Korean Charm Travel onward (approximately one hour) to Jeonju, a city celebrated for maintaining Korea's traditional culture. Visit Jeonju Hanok Village, known for its atmospheric charm and approximately 700 beautifully preserved Hanok homes. Wander leisurely and immerse yourself fully in timeless Korean aesthetics and cultural heritage. Relax and Recharge Check into your comfortable accommodation and enjoy a relaxing evening and leisure time, reflecting on the day’s vibrant historical journey.

Jeonju - Yeosu, South Korea: Heritage, Democracy & Coastal Beauty Adventure Morning Refreshments and Departure Begin your day with a tasty breakfast at your hotel before gearing up for today's journey full of stories, scenery, and history. Drive to Vibrant Gwangju—a Symbol of Democracy Departing from Jeonju, travel comfortably towards lively Gwangju, the cultural and political heart of Korea's Honam region. Renowned for its pivotal role in the country's modern democratic movement, Gwangju offers a profound glimpse into Korea’s resilient spirit. Visit the May 18th National Cemetery Pay respects at the poignant May 18th National Cemetery, dedicated to those who bravely struggled for democracy during the 1980 Gwangju Democratic Uprising. This tranquil yet powerful place provides deep insight into a significant national chapter. Discover Natural Beauty at Suncheon Bay Garden Continue the journey towards Suncheon, famed for its pristine natural surroundings. Wander leisurely through spectacular Suncheon Bay Garden, a breathtaking ecological park boasting colorful flowers, themed gardens, serene ponds, and charming walking paths that showcase Korea's commitment to sustainability and ecological preservation. Historic Yeosu—A Coastal City's Heroic Past Next, travel to the picturesque coastal city of Yeosu, rich in maritime history and culture. Explore the historic site of Admiral Yi Sun-sin’s Path, retracing the heroic footsteps of Korea's legendary naval commander famous for protecting the country from invasions. Immerse yourself in the city's charming ocean views and admire historical monuments dedicated to Admiral Yi, breathing life into the nation's proud maritime heritage. Restful Evening in Yeosu After a satisfying day filled with culture, history, and nature, check into your comfortable hotel in Yeosu or Gwangyang area. Enjoy a restful and relaxing night, savoring the memories from today's memorable exploration.

Yeosu - Gyeongju, South Korea: Fortresses, Seafood and Scenic Coastal Beauty Start the Day with Breakfast Begin your morning with a delicious breakfast at your hotel and prepare for another adventurous day exploring Korea’s rich culture and picturesque coastal towns. Experience Korea’s Valiant History at Jinjuseong Fortress Depart from Yeosu after breakfast, travelling comfortably toward the city of Jinju. Visit the impressive Jinjuseong Fortress, renowned for its heroic resistance during the Japanese invasion of 1592. Stroll around the fort’s historic walls, gates, and pavilions, and immerse yourself in the stories of bravery and resilience that shaped Korea’s proud heritage. Depart for Vibrant Busan City Continue your journey eastward towards Busan, Korea's energetic port city famed for its lively atmosphere, beautiful beaches, and delicious seafood. Busan Arrival and Convenient Pickup Upon arrival in Busan, you'll make a quick stop at Gimhae Domestic Airport to welcome additional travellers joining the tour. Another easy pickup spot will be available in front of Toyoko Inn Hotel 1, situated conveniently by Busan Station at 13:00. Explore Bustling Jagalchi Fish Market Immerse yourself in the vibrant local life at Jagalchi Market, Korea’s largest seafood marketplace bustling with vendors offering fresh daily catches. Witness a lively local atmosphere, sample freshly caught seafood, and explore the colourful array of stalls packed with various ocean delicacies. Relax at Scenic Haeundae Beach & Dongbaek Park Head to Busan’s famed Haeundae Beach, a stunning location beloved for its pristine sands, blue waters, and vibrant seaside atmosphere. Nearby, peacefully stroll around Dongbaek Park, known for its beautiful camellia trees, spectacular coastal trails, and the iconic Nurimaru APEC House with panoramic ocean views. Departing Busan for Gyeongju – Korea’s Ancient Capital Late afternoon, it's time to leave Busan and continue onwards to historic Gyeongju, known as "the museum without walls", due to its incredible abundance of historical treasures scattered throughout the city. Relax & Recharge in Gyeongju Check into your comfortable hotel accommodation in Gyeongju and enjoy leisure time to unwind and relax, reflecting upon the day of memorable sights, cultural explorations, and scenic beauty.

Gyeongju - Pyeongchang, South Korea: Temples, Folk Villages & Mountain Serenity Morning Delights– Breakfast Time Enjoy breakfast at your hotel, preparing for an inspiring day filled with spiritual wonders, historical immersion, and nature's calming presence. UNESCO Heritage of Gyeongju– Seokguram Grotto & Bulguksa Temple Your adventure begins at the breathtaking Seokguram Grotto (UNESCO site), a striking masterpiece of Buddhist art carved elegantly into a mountainside. Stand in awe before the serene stone Buddha that radiates an unparalleled sense of tranquillity and artistic magnificence. Next, explore the beautiful Bulguksa Temple (another UNESCO site), acclaimed worldwide for its splendid architecture, intricately carved stone pagodas, and timeless religious serenity. Take your time to wander the scenic temple grounds and marvel at centuries-old structures, exceptional stone relics, and graceful gardens—each detail compelling in its beauty. Step into a Living History at Andong Hahoe Folk Village Next, make your way to the charming village of Andong Hahoe. Designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site, the village carefully preserves authentic Joseon-era architecture, folk art, and community traditions. Wander along narrow pathways lined with traditional Hanok houses, experience life as it was centuries ago, and immerse yourself in the harmony of this beautifully preserved, still-inhabited village. Queen Elizabeth II's personal visit brought international fame to this splendid representation of Korean heritage and culture. Serenity of Wonju– Mountains, Rivers, and Heritage From Andong, journey onwards toward Wonju, a tranquil city nestled amid lush natural surroundings, embraced gracefully by the lovely Chiaksan Mountain and the calmly flowing waters of the Seom River. Historically revered as the capital city of Gangwon Province during the Joseon Dynasty, Wonju retains deep-rooted cultural traditions and captivating historical monuments. Take in the soothing scenery and peaceful ambiance upon your arrival. Evening Relaxation and Leisure in Wonju Check into your comfortable accommodation, indulge in some quiet time, and reflect upon a memorable day blending temple wonders, vibrant Korean folk history, and restorative natural beauty.

Pyeongchang - Seoul, South Korea: Olympic Memories, Majestic Peaks & Scenic Wonders Energizing Morning Breakfast Start your final day's adventure with a hearty breakfast at your hotel in Wonju to boost your energy before the journey ahead. Pyeongchang – Home of the Winter Olympic Spirit Travel to iconic Pyeongchang, the proud host city of the 2018 Winter Olympics. Visit the historic Olympic Ski Jumping Stadium, where world-renowned athletes once competed courageously. Reflect upon this memorable location, filled with echoes of sporting triumphs and the indomitable Olympic spirit. (Note: Visit the stadium area, however the ski jump tower itself is not included.) Majestic Splendor– Mt. Seorak National Park Proceed onward to spectacular Mt. Seorak National Park, Korea's celebrated UNESCO Biosphere Reserve. Renowned for its incredible mountain peaks emerging from misty clouds, lush forests, rare wildlife species, and crystal-clear streams gently flowing through emerald valleys, Seoraksan offers breathtaking landscapes at every turn. Optional Scenic Cable Car Journey - Gwongeumseong Fortress Enhance your visit by taking the optional cable car ride to Gwongeumseong Fortress. From this vantage point, admire stunning panoramic vistas of the park’s dramatic mountain peaks and surrounding valleys – a sight certain to linger in your memory long after the journey concludes. Important Notice During Peak Season Due to limited accessibility during peak autumn foliage season in October, Seoraksan National Park restricts large and medium-sized buses. If these regulations are active, the bus will park at C District Square, requiring a scenic but moderately demanding 3.6km walk to reach the park entrance. Please note that if walking is not suitable, the visit to Seoraksan might not be possible during this period. Journey Back to Seoul In the afternoon, relax onboard as you return comfortably towards bustling Seoul city, reminiscing about the memories made at Korea's symbolic sites, inspirational natural wonders, and historic landmarks. Arrival in Seoul & Farewell Your exciting tour concludes at Donghwa Duty Free Shop Building, located conveniently at Gwanghwamun Intersection, ready to continue your exploration of vibrant Seoul or proceed to your next Korean adventure.

tourName: Discover South Korea small group holiday
generalInfo:
This 12-day exploration packs in a wealth of highlights across this beautiful country. From the cosmopolitan city of Seoul to the ancient Silla capital of Gyeongju, South Korea has a lot to offer. Discover a dynamic, friendly and modern country that is steeped in culture, history and tradition.

Seoul and the DMZ - Explore the dynamic capital that contrasts starkly with the demilitarized border with North Korea
Korean cuisine - Fresh, regional and delicious, the food is a highlight for many visitors
Golgulsa Temple visit - Meet Korean Buddhist monks, practice meditation and learn about Sunmudo

dayInfo.title: Join trip in Seoul
dayInfo.description: : Arrive in Seoul, South Korea's dynamic capital and one of the world's fastest growing cities. The economic, political and cultural centre of the country, Seoul is a fascinating mix of glass towers, historic temples, parks and museums, spanning the banks of the Han River. For those arriving on time our Leader plans to meet you in the hotel reception at 7.45pm for those that wish to go out for dinner. There are no other activities planned today, so you are free to arrive in Seoul at any time. With many flights arriving in the late afternoon and evening the introductory welcome meeting will normally happen first thing on the morning of day 2. The Tour Leader will need to confirm numbers for the Busan optional cookery and rice wine making excursions first thing today or tomorrow and take payment in Korean Won, please note that these may be fully booked in peak season and unavailable. If you would like to receive a complimentary airport transfer today, you'll need to arrive into Incheon International Airport (ICN), which is a one-and-a-half-hour drive from our hotel. Should you miss the welcome meeting, your Leader will inform you of any essential information as soon as you catch up the next morning. Hotel check in starts from 3pm and is strictly followed. If you require an early check in, there is an additional fee and dependent on availability. If your flight arrives earlier in the day, perhaps you might choose to visit the 600-year-old Bukchon Hanok Village. Comprising of little alley ways and artisan displays, this is a beautiful place to get lost in for an afternoon.

dayInfo.title: A full day exploring Seoul by public transport
dayInfo.description: : Today we explore the city like a local, using public transport. Walking through Gwanghwamun gate, we visit Gyeongbokgung Palace, the main royal palace of the Joseon Dynasty. Originally built in 1395, it was expanded in 1867 to become the largest, and arguably most beautiful of Seoul's five palaces, with 330 buildings in total. Next up this morning is a visit to the National Museum of Contemporary Korean History for insights into how Korea propelled itself from being an agricultural society to the modern economic powerhouse that it is today. This afternoon, we visit Cheonggyecheon Stream which flows through downtown Seoul and offers a peaceful oasis amidst the hustle and bustle of the city. After Tapgol Park, we walk down into Insadong, a neighbourhood steeped in tradition and a great place to see Korea culture and explore traditional arts and crafts. We continue to the neighbouring Ikseon-dong Hanok Village famous for its traditional houses, cafes, pubs and restaurants. We take a stroll through Myeongdong to learn more about K-pop culture through local themed shops and locations often featured in dramas and music videos. Finally we end the day at Gwangjang Market, one of the oldest and largest traditional markets in Korea. The most popular section of the market is the food street that caters to a wide range of menus like gimbap, mung bean pancake, tteok-bokki and eomuk. It's time for a taste of traditional Korean cuisine. After the food sampling, take the subway back to the hotel.

dayInfo.title: Visit the Demilitarised Zone (DMZ). Free afternoon
dayInfo.description: : Today we experience one of the last frontiers of the Cold War - the Demilitarised Zone (DMZ) that separates North and South Korea - an area where over a million soldiers remain on high alert on either side. The Korean War has never technically or officially ended - and this geo-political fault line is still raw for the people of Korea. We make an early start this morning, leaving at around 7am and the bus ride to the DMZ takes a little over one hour. Our Tour Leader stays behind, military clearance is obtained for all visitors, you will need to bring your passport along with you and we join into a larger group of day trippers as we are escorted by the military right into the DMZ. Our next stop is underground to explore the Third Infiltration Tunnel built by the North into South Korea with the aim to breach the border. This was found by accident - the tunnel is wide enough for 2000 troops an hour to pass through and is just 1 of 4 that were subsequently discovered. We also visit Imjingak Park, the DMZ Museum and the Dora Observatory. Please be aware that due to the nature of the area visited this excursion may be cancelled at short notice depending on the security situation. Please note that the Joint Security Area (JSA, often referred to as the Truce Village or Panmunjom) is currently closed to visitors due to tensions. This is the only area where the North and South Korean forces stand face-to-face, and diplomatic meetings happen. If the situation changes and we are able to visit the JSA, please note that you must be respectfully dressed, no jeans or sandals are allowed nor can you make any arm or hand gestures as visitors are closely monitored (and photographed) by the North Koreans for propaganda purposes. The rest of the afternoon is at leisure. There is the option to continue your Seoul exploration with the Tour Leader for a visit to Naksan Park to see and walk for an hour or two alongside Hanyangdoseong - a defensive city wall built more than 600 years ago.

dayInfo.title: High speed train to Andong. Visit Hahoe Folk Village. Drive to Gyeongju
dayInfo.description: : We leave the capital this morning as we start our tour of South Korea with a two-hour ride on the high speed KTX train to Andong, a town that is often considered the spiritual and cultural heart of South Korea. Upon arrival we are met by our vehicle and our first visit is the scenic Buyongdae Cliff that offers stunning views of Hahoe Village, Nakdonggang River and surrounding mountains. Only accessible on foot, the walk up to the viewpoint takes about 10 minutes in each direction. Then it's time to explore the UNESCO-listed Hahoe Folk Village - known for its well-preserved Joseon Dynasty architecture, including its thatched-roof houses and tile-roofed mansions. Continue to the fascinating Mask Museum which is home to a collection of over 800 masks from over 50 countries. The masks are displayed in five exhibition halls, each of which focuses on a different region or culture. Our next stop is the 500-year old Byeongsan-seowon Confucian Academy - renowned for its stunning architectural design and the harmony between the buildings and the natural landscape. Finally we drive two hours further south to Gyeongju, our base for the next three nights. Once the capital of the ancient kingdom of Silla, the Gyeongju elite ruled over much of the Korean Peninsula between the 7th and 9th centuries. If your hotel is located on Lake Bosun, it is worth noting that there is a footpath around the lake which makes for a pleasant stroll or run.

dayInfo.title: Morning Namsan Mountain Hike. Afternoon visit to Gyeongju Museum and Tumuli Park
dayInfo.description: : South Korea is a naturally beautiful country and this morning we aim to experience nature with a hike on Namsan Mountain - also home to over 100 temples, 80 stone Buddha statues and 60 stone pagodas. The three-hour hiking route follows a well-maintained trail, covers approximately 6km/4miles in distance and there are 465 metres/1525 feet of ascent and descent and we have graded the walk as Moderate. You can get more details from the Tour Leader and decide on the day but you may choose to opt out of this and spend the morning at leisure in Gyeongju. We take a break for lunch at a local restaurant to try some Korean food. For example in summer this could be Gyeongju Milmyeon, a popular local dish with chewy wheat noodles in a refreshing cold broth, perfect for hot days. This afternoon, we are back in Gyeongju and we start off with a visit to the National Museum for a comprehensive insight into the art, culture and history of the Silla dynasty - one of the longest in Asian history. In the Daereungwon tomb complex in Tumuli Park, we to take a stroll and pay respects to the Silla rulers. We'll also see Cheomseongdae observatory and Family Choi's House, the oldest house in the area built in the 1600s.

dayInfo.title: Morning visit to Gyeongju Seokguram Grotto. Afternoon Golgulsa Temple Experience
dayInfo.description: : After a leisurely breakfast, we drive to visit Seokguram Grotto which is a part of the Bulguksa temple complex, one of the most famous and important Buddhist temples in Korea. The temple was first built during the Silla Dynasty and destroyed by fire during the Japanese invasions of Korea in the 16th century. It was rebuilt in the 17th century, however many original buildings and treasures were lost. After some time for lunch we continue to Golgulsa Temple for a memorable temple experience. This will give you the unique opportunity to experience the simple, yet rewarding, lifestyle of Korean Buddhist monks. There will be the chance to learn about and participate in activities such as archery, meditation and Sunmudo - a meditative martial art that combines spiritual elements such as meditation, yoga and qigong with dynamic striking and defensive techniques. In the early evening we will have a simple vegetarian dinner at the temple before driving back towards our hotel. If time allows, we will end with a walk on Woljeong Bridge, an historical gateway connecting the royal palaces of Silla to the south.

dayInfo.title: Visit Bulguksa Temple. Drive to Busan. City tour
dayInfo.description: : After breakfast and checkout, we return to Bulguksa Temple to visit the main temple group. Continuing south we drive one and a half hours to Busan, which sits on the beautiful south coast. A busy port city renowned for its beaches, mountains and delicious seafood, Busan grew rapidly during the fighting phase of the Korean War (1950-53) as the de facto capital of the south. Today it has a similar modern spirit to Seoul but is defined and differentiated by its links to the sea. Upon arrival we hit the ground running and start our tour with a visit to the United Nations Memorial Cemetery, a significant and poignant site commemorating the Korean War where we can pay respects to the fallen soldiers but also gain a deeper understanding of the conflict. Moving on, we visit the colourful and tightly-knit houses of Gamcheon Cultural Village - a neighbourhood originally settled by wartime refugees. Next we see some of the beaches and coastline that Busan is known for with a scenic walk on a raised walkway along the coastline of Dongbaekseom Island (island of camellias) - located at the right end of famous Haeundae Beach. If time permits we will try to catch the sunset at Dalmaji Hill, with panoramic views of Haeundae Beach. The walk to the viewpoint takes about 30 minutes each way. Please note that the order of visits today can change according to our hotel location and end point.

dayInfo.title: In Busan. Morning free – optional cooking or Makgeolli brewing experience. Afternoon sightseeing
dayInfo.description: : The morning has been left free for you to relax and enjoy Busan. If you are interested there is the option to delve into the world of local cuisine! Immerse yourself in a cooking class (minimum 4 clients) where you'll learn the secrets of authentic regional specialties. The instructors will guide you through each step with clear English instructions and demonstrations. After the class, you'll be treated to lunch featuring the dishes you've prepared. Another option is to be introduced to the diverse world of Korean alcohol with a visit to a traditional brewery which specialises in making its own makgeolli - a lightly sparkling rice wine. The brewing, straining and tasting should take around 80 minutes and a minimum of 5 clients is required. We regroup this afternoon and continue exploring Busan with a visit to Gukje Market - one of the oldest markets in the city. Just a short walk from Gukje Market is Jagalchi Fish Market, which is South Korea's largest seafood market. It's an excellent opportunity to experience the local seafood culture. Later this afternoon we drive to a spot near Haeundae beach to board the Busan Sky Capsule - a scenic aerial rail journey that runs 2km along the coast to Cheongsapo Station. After walking back the same route and some time to explore Haeundae beach, we make our way back to the hotel.

dayInfo.title: Drive to Gwangju. Explore this cultural and artistic city
dayInfo.description: : This morning after breakfast we continue our journey with a three-hour drive to Gwangju. The city has a long history at the centre of Korea's democratic and human rights movements and nowadays serves as a cultural and artistic hub in the south, as well as leading the way in media arts and high-tech science. After dropping our bags off at the hotel there will be some time for lunch. The area is known particularly for kimchi, hanjeongsik (Korean table d'hote), Mudeungsan boribap (barley rice), tteokgalbi (grilled galbi patties), and ori tang (duck soup). This afternoon we kick off our city tour with panoramic views of Gwangju's sprawling urban landscape and beyond from the iconic Sajik Park Tower observatory platform. Next, dive into Gwangju's storied past with a walk through the historical site and missionary houses of Yangnim-dong village. While in Yangnim-dong, we take a break at Lee Lee Nam Studio, a multi-functional space that contains a writer's studio, the Media Art Museum and a coffee shop. We finish on a historical, poignant and moving note at the 5-18 Memorial Park and May 18th National Cemetery. These sites honour the victims of the 1980 Gwangju Uprising and the accompanying museum features informative exhibits about this important historical event.

dayInfo.title: Visit Mudeungsan National Park. Drive to Jeonju
dayInfo.description: : After checkout this morning we drive just outside of the city to Mudeungsan National Park. We take an easy 40-minute hike along to Jeungsimsa Temple where you can relax and enjoy the serene, spiritual ambiance of this historic Buddhist temple. On our return walk we stop at Uijae Museum of Korean Art, an impressive art gallery located on the mountain side. After this break in nature we drive north to Jeonju which ranks as one of South Korea's most popular destinations for the locals thanks to its historic architecture and buzzing food scene. Named a UNESCO City of Gastronomy in 2012, Jeonju is the birthplace of the famed Korean dish bibimbap and our first stop will be to have it for lunch at a local restaurant. After lunch we start to explore the city starting with the majestic 14th century Pungnammun Gate, the only city gate of the four left standing. Continue to Jeondong Catholic Church and Gyeonggijeon Shrine which houses the royal portrait of the founder of the Joseon Dynasty. Finally, we visit Nambu Market, a bustling traditional market overflowing with fresh produce, local crafts and restaurants. Later tonight in your free time you may choose to visit the Hanok village as it is lit up, lively and has plenty of street food options.

dayInfo.title: Visit Jeonju Hanok Village. High speed train to Seoul
dayInfo.description: : Hanoks are the traditional homes of the Korean upper class from times gone by, with slate-tile roofs, whitewashed adobe walls and hidden courtyards. Jeonju has one of the country's largest collections of them - now restored and housing workshops, museums, boutique shops and teahouses. This morning after leaving the hotel we delve into this rich cultural heritage and stroll the cobbled alleyways to admire the architecture. We plan to catch the two-hour KTX bullet train to Seoul around mid to late-morning, which should see us arrive into Seoul in time for lunch. After dropping our luggage at the hotel, the rest of the afternoon is at leisure for you to explore the city some more or do some shopping.

dayInfo.title: Trip ends in Seoul
dayInfo.description: : The trip ends after breakfast at our hotel in Seoul. There are no activities planned today, so you are free to depart from Seoul at any time. If your flight is departing later in the day luggage storage facilities are available at our hotel. If you would like to receive a complimentary airport transfer today, you need to depart from Incheon International Airport (ICN), which is about a one-and-a-half-hour drive from our hotel.

tourName: K-Pop tour in South Korea, 9 days
generalInfo:
Experience the vibrant rhythm of South Korea through the lens of your favourite idols on our 9-day Korea K-Pop tour. Journey from the dynamic heart of Seoul to the cultural streets of Gwangju and the coastal city of Busan. Immerse yourself in the electrifying world of K-Pop as you visit iconic locations where idols trained, socialised, and are celebrated with murals. Explore bustling cities, traverse traditional streets, and enjoy a breath of sea air on this epic Korea K-Pop Tour!

Included in all tours:

An epic Adventure Leader, aka a local legend, to turn your trip into the adventure of a lifetime
Local transport within South Korea, including the KTX from Busan to Seoul on Day 8. Transport for all optional and independent activities is not included.
Accommodation including local hostels

Accommodation style:

In true backpacking style, our accommodation is in shared, mixed-gender dorm rooms as standard on this tour. But if you’d prefer a little extra comfort and your own space to relax after an action-packed day, room upgrades are available. Please request this on booking.

Included activities:

Namsan Mountain cable car (Seoul)
K-Pop Dance Class (Seoul)
Gyeongbokgung Palace (Seoul)
Half-day at the DMZ and North Korean defector Q&A (Seoul)
Learn about the K-Wave and visit HIKR Ground (Seoul)
Visit BTS RM Forest (Seoul)
See Chungjang K-Pop Star Street (Gwangju)
Marvel at the Hope World Sculpture (Gwangju)
Tour around Gamcheon Village (Busan)
Songdo Marine Cable Car (Busan)
Busan Citizen Park (Busan)
Makeup Masterclass (Seoul)

dayInfo.description: Seoul: Your Korea K-Pop adventure commences today with an informative session led by your Adventure Leader at your hostel. During this session, you'll receive a detailed itinerary for the week and valuable insights on how to adapt to local life in Korea, along with essential safety tips. Later in the day, you'll have the option to join your fellow tour participants for a group dinner in Myeongdong. Afterward, you'll collectively explore the Myeongdong Underground Shopping Center, renowned for offering an array of K-Pop merchandise at budget-friendly prices. Following this shopping excursion, you'll embark on your first captivating tour experience. Your journey will take you via public transportation to Namsan Mountain. Upon reaching the mountain, you'll board a cable car that transports you to the summit. If you wish, you can further elevate your experience by visiting the Seoul N Tower, where you'll be treated to awe-inspiring views of Seoul's mesmerizing skyline.

Seoul: Today begins early with an enlightening journey north to the Demilitarized Zone (DMZ). Your first stop is the Dora Observatory, a site that provides a unique perspective on the nearby North Korean villages. You'll be equipped with binoculars to observe the landscape. Additionally, you'll venture into the third tunnel, reaching a remarkable proximity of just 170 meters from North Korea. Returning to Seoul just before lunch, you'll have the opportunity for a remarkable encounter. Engage in a Q&A session with a Korean defector who will candidly share their personal experiences. In the afternoon, it's time to channel your inner K-Pop star. Participate in a captivating dance class led by K-Pop experts who will guide you through choreography step by step. By the end of the session, you'll be dancing like a professional. In the evening, you have the choice to experience the vibrant nightlife of Hongdae, offering a dynamic and exciting atmosphere.

Seoul: In the morning, hop on public transport for a visit to the illustrious Gyeongbokgung Palace. Arriving just in time at 10 am, you'll witness the impressive Royal Guard Changing Ceremony, a captivating tradition. Nearby, there's the option to rent beautiful hanbok, traditional garments, adding a touch of authenticity to your palace visit. Explore the palace's splendid residences, pavilions, and ornate gates at your leisure for a couple of hours. Early in the afternoon, your journey continues to Insadong, passing through the charming Bukchon Hanok Village. Here, you can explore KTown4U, a treasure trove for rare merchandise. Next up, visit HIKR Ground, a futuristic cultural center where you'll dive into the world of the K-Wave and even create your own music video! If you're inclined, the evening offers the opportunity to join your group for dinner and drinks in the vibrant neighborhood of Itaewon.

Seoul: Your morning adventure unfolds with a visit to Hallyu K-Star Road, where you'll encounter the iconic Gangnam Dolls. Here's your chance to snap a photo with the doll of your favorite K-Pop group! Around midday, delve into the vibrant atmosphere of COEX Mall, a sprawling complex filled with restaurants, stores, K-Pop memorabilia, a remarkable library, and the famous Gangnam Style statue. Don't forget to check out HYBE Insight, located nearby in Samseong. In the afternoon, a leisurely stroll awaits you in the BTS RM Forest, a living tribute planted in celebration of the rapper's birthday and his dedication to environmental preservation. For the evening, the choice is yours as you have a free night to explore Jamsil, one of Seoul's more upscale districts. Enjoy the unique atmosphere and attractions this affluent area has to offer.

Gwangju: Your morning journey takes you to your next destination, Gwangju. After checking in at your hostel in the afternoon, you'll head to Chungjang K-Pop Star Street. This vibrant street pays homage to all the K-Pop idols from Gwangju who've realized their dreams. While exploring this area, be sure to admire the handprint art, featuring handprints of idols, the star memorial hall, and the fan zone, where idols have generously donated their personal items for fans to enjoy. Your next stop is the Hope World sculpture, an artistic tribute to BTS's J-Hope, who hails from Gwangju. This monument is adorned with over 21,000 messages from ARMYs around the world. Afterward, you'll explore Penguin Village, a mural village adorned with arts, crafts, and more murals dedicated to J-Hope. In the evening, you have the option to visit the 1913 Songjong Station Market, a bustling marketplace offering a taste of local life and flavors.

Busan: You'll embark on a bus journey to the vibrant city of Busan. Upon arrival, your first stop will be the Gamcheon Culture Village, famous as a popular filming location. While you're here, be sure to admire the mural dedicated to BTS's Jimin and Jungkook, both of whom hail from Busan. After your visit, proceed to Songdo Beach, where you'll have the opportunity to take the Songdo Marine Cable Car. This ride will treat you to breathtaking views of the Busan coastline. You'll then return to the BIFF Entertainment Square to explore this trendy area. Your evening is free for you to explore at your own pace or enjoy some leisure time.

Busan: Start your morning with a visit to Busan Citizen Park, a place made famous by BTS's V. While here, you can recreate the iconic visit and snap a memorable photo. The park was also recently used in Busan Tourism ads starting NewJeans. Afterward, you have the option to relax in a Korean jjimjilbang, a traditional Korean bathhouse. Your tour guide will provide clear instructions on how to get there, even though they might not accompany you. Alternatively, you can choose to visit Jimin's favorite place in Busan, Dadaepo Beach. This beautiful sandy beach is located at the Nakdonggang estuary where it meets the South Sea and features a massive fountain at the entrance. You'll have time to explore the area before heading back to the hostel. Tonight, you can opt to join your group for a K-Pop karaoke session in Haeundae!

Seoul: This morning, you'll return to Seoul via a high-speed rail. Your final memorable activity in Seoul awaits you - a one-of-a-kind makeup masterclass with a team of renowned Seoul MUAs. They will guide you through the products and techniques to achieve the same glamorous look as your beloved K-Pop stars.

Seoul: Say your goodbyes to your newfound tour friends, as today sadly concludes your K-Pop adventure in South Korea. We can help you book additional accommodation if you wish to extend your stay in Seoul!

generalInfo:
Explore South Korea in style on our 10 day Premium Tour. Discover this country that is an irresistible fusion of natural beauty, culture and gastronomic delight!

Take in some of Asia’s most buzzing cities, mountainous tranquility and an idyllic island on this varied 10 day-tour. Your adventure leader will help reveal the magic of this country with a whole series of hands-on experiences. From a temple visit in the mountains, an overnight stay in a traditional Hanok, to visiting the DMZ and peering into the kingdom of North Korea – this tour packs a real punch. Plus there’s plenty of opportunities to sample the rich variety of Korean cuisine.

Included in all tours:

An epic Adventure Leader, aka a local legend, to turn your trip into the adventure of a lifetime
All local transport within South Korea, for included activities.
Accommodation (including hotels and Hanok stay)
Meals provided: All Breakfasts, 4 lunches, 4 Dinners (all other food and drink throughout the tour is not included)

Accommodation style:

To make your journey smooth and relaxing, rest assured, all of our Plus tours include stays in carefully selected 4* hotels. After days packed with adventure, you’ll have room to unwind, recharge and get ready for the next experience. Want a little extra space or privacy? Upgrade options are available – just let us know when you book.

Included Activities:

Welcome dinner (Seoul)
Namsan Mountain cable car & Seoul N Tower (Seoul)
Gyeongbokgung Palace visit (Seoul)
Lunch in Bukchon Hanok Village (Seoul)
Bukchon Hanok Village & Insadong Art Street visit (Seoul)
Half-day DMZ Tour & talk with North Korean defector (Seoul)
Nanta Show (Seoul)
Cycle tour, with visits to Chunmachong Ancient Tombs, Daereungwon Tumuli Park, and Cheomseongdae (Gyeongju)
Traditional hanok meal (Gyeongju)
Anapji Pond evening visit (Gyeongju)
Traditional liquor tasting evening (Gyeongju)
Full day Golgulsa Temple visit and experience (Gyeongju)
Haedong Yonggungsa Temple visit (Busan)
Busan tour inc. Gamcheon Culture Village, Songdo Marine Cable Car, BIFF Square (Busan)
Traditional cooking class (Busan)
Haeundae sightseeing boat party (Busan)
Yacht sailing & fishing experience (Jeju)
Half-day hike (Jeju)
Farewell BBQ Dinner (Jeju)

dayInfo.description: Seoul: Start this adventure in this fascinating nation with a delicious group dinner to whet your appetite for what's to come. We'll then head up to the top of Seoul's N Tower for a sweeping vista of the city-scape beneath. Take the cable car up to the top and explore Namsan Tower before taking the cable car back down and enjoying an evening in the city.

Seoul: We start our day at Gyeongbokgung Palace to watch the Royal Guard Changing Ceremony. There is the option to rent Hanbok - traditional Korean clothes - before entering the palace grounds, where you will be free to explore as you wish. Enjoy a group lunch at Bukchon Hanok Village, before exploring the hidden gems and the surrounding area in Insadong. Tonight, you have the option to sing your hearts out during Karaoke.

Seoul: A fascinating day where we discover the tragic history of this divided pennisula with a visit to the border with North Korea known as the DMZ. We can gaze into the hermit kingdom and see the tunnels built to invade the South. Get an insight into life in the North with a Q and A with a defector. After a truly remarkable morning - it's time to head back into town and explore the bustling Hongdae. That evening, sit back and relax as we watch the hybrid cooking-comedy-acrobatics - Nanta Show. If you wish to have drinks tonight, there is the option to hang out in the bustling Myeongdong area.

Gyeongju: Bid farewell to Seoul as we travel to Gyeongju. Once you arrive, there will be time for lunch before taking part in a cycling tour of Gyeongju. If you cannot ride a bike, this tour can be done by walking too! Tonight, we are staying at a traditonal Hanok, a Korean traditional House). You will enjoy a traditonal meal at a Hanok. Whilst here, there is the option to also enjoy a Liquor tasting led by our Adventure Leader! If you don't drink, you can enjoy some local snacks and soft drinks instead. End the night as the group heads to Anapji for amazing night views of the pond.

Gyeongju: Today, we are heading to Golgulsa Temple. Once arriving at the Temple, you will be able to take part in a selection of activities, such as an Archery Lesson, Sunmudo Training Session, and Meditation and more. Enjoy Vegetarian food throughout your time at the Temple and then we will board a private bus to Busan in the evening. Check in to the hotel when you arrive.

Busan: Board the bus and we are visiting Haedong Yonggungsa Temple, a stunning Temple on the coastline. It is then time for a private tour of Busan, visiting Gamcheon Village where you will be given free time to explore the colourful buildings. Take the cable car up over to Songdo and enjoy some sightseeing here with ocean views. Head to BIFF Square and shopping area in Nampo-dong this afternoon, before spending a free afternoon exploring and relaxing in Haeundae.

Busan: This morning, we hope you have your chef's hat on, as it is time for a cooking class! After mastering your cooking skills, you have a free afternoon to explore Busan as you wish. Recommended activity is to check out a Jjimjilbang - a Korean Spa. Relax in the many saunas and pools and enjoy a well needed rest. There is also the opportunity to enjoy a Pottery Making Class, let us know in advance if you would like to join this! Tonight, you will see Busan by boat, as we hop on a sightseeing trip for night views of Haenudae. Enjoy music, drinks and snacks on the boat.

Jeju: Hop on a quick flight down to the island paradise of Jeju. Once arrived, we will check in and relax before heading out this afternoon. It is time for more sailing! This time, we are heading out on a Yacht sailing tour with fishing. Dinner and drinks after can be at your own leisure.

Jeju: Today you will enjoy a half day nature hike, visiting Olle Trail No.7 where you can take in the views of Oedolgae rock and the crashing waves. It is a mostly flat path so most abilities can manage this! Take a visit to Jeongbang Waterfall afterwards and enjoy the sound of the water hitting the rocks below. This afternoon, you are free to enjoy the island as you wish. Suggested activities include visiting Seongsan Ilchulbang, Sangumburi, or Jeju Folk Village. Tonight, we will dine together with a farewell BBQ dinner!
Jeju-Seoul: We have reached the end of the tour. You can either fly back to Seoul (included in the trip price) or extend your stay in this island.

tourName: Seoul 4 day tour in South Korea
generalInfo:
This 4-day South Korea tour captures the country’s ultimate highlights – from a taekwondo class with expert instructors to dancing like a K-pop star. Take in sweeping views from the top of Namsan Mountain, visit the historic Demilitarised Zone, and witness the Royal Guard Changing Ceremony at Gyeongbokgung Palace. Whether it’s your first visit or a quick escape, experience the best of South Korea in one unforgettable trip.

Included in all tours:

An epic Adventure Leader, aka a local legend, to turn your trip into the adventure of a lifetime
All local transport within Seoul
Accommodation

Accommodation style:

In true backpacking style, our accommodation is in shared, mixed-gender dorm rooms as standard on this tour. But if you’d prefer a little extra comfort and your own space to relax after an action-packed day, room upgrades are available. Please request this on booking.

Included activities:

Taekwondo Class
Group welcome dinner
Namsan Cable Car Ride
Visit to Gyeongbokgung Palace
Tour around the DMZ, including Dora Observatory, tunnels, and Q&A with North Korean defector
K-Pop Class

dayInfo.description: Seoul: Prepare to kick off your South Korea adventure tour by meeting your guide and fellow travellers at the hostel in the afternoon. Get started with a pre-departure briefing to learn all about your trip and get to know your group while trying out Taekwondo and practicing some basic Korean phrases. Next, head out to explore Myeongdong and enjoy a welcome dinner with your fellow travellers! Bond over some delicious Korean food and Soju - before making your way up to the top of Namsan Mountain, where you'll be treated to breathtaking views of Seoul at night. Take a stroll through the "padlocks of love" and enjoy the romantic atmosphere before making your way to the top of the Seoul N Tower for even better views of the city. Afterward, hop on public transport back to your accommodation in the trendy district of Hongdae. Take some time to wander around and discover the area or rest up for your first full day of adventures tomorrow.

Seoul: Get ready for a cultural immersion as you explore the ancient side of Seoul today. Rise early and take the metro to Gyeongbokgung Palace, where you'll witness the Royal Guard Changing Ceremony and have the chance to tour the palace grounds. For an even more immersive experience, consider renting a hanbok and strolling around the palace like a true Joseon Dynasty royal. This afternoon you have a choice of what to do. Either head to Bukchon Hanok Village, a traditional Korean neighborhood lined with centuries-old wooden homes. Or, perhaps you would prefer to do one of the following: - Insadong Art Street - Take a visit to Gangnam District - Rent a bike and cycle along Han river - Visit HIKR ground - cultural centre where you can record your own music video and learn about K-wave There is even an option to take part in a Perfume Making Class. Choose your scents and combine to make your own personalised perfume. Let us know if you would be interested in this! In the evening, you can have food and drinks in the Euljiro/Itaewon districts.

Seoul: On the 3rd day of your South Korea adventure tour, you'll be visiting the Korean Demilitarized Zone. After grabbing breakfast at Imjingak, you'll head to Dora Observatory to see the nearest North Korean villages through binoculars. You might even see some people in the streets if you're lucky! Next, you'll descend into the 3rd Tunnel created by North Koreans, taking you as close as 170m to North Korea. After this unique experience, you'll begin your journey back to Seoul with a special opportunity to talk to a North Korean defector on the bus. Once you're back in Seoul, you'll have a chance to try out a K-Pop Dance Class and then enjoy a night out in the lively district of Hongdae, known for its endless restaurant and bar options.
It’s the final day of your South Korea adventure! Say goodbye to your travel crew and head off with new friends, epic memories and stories you’ll be telling for years to come.

Extension: Temple Stay Experience at Geumsunsa. Can’t get enough of Korea? Extend your adventure for £75 per person and enjoy an overnight stay at Geumsunsa Temple. Start the morning with a relaxed stroll through Seoul, giving you time to wander, recharge, or simply soak in the city’s vibrant energy. Midday, we’ll whisk you away to Geumsunsa Temple for an authentic templestay. A private transfer brings us mid-afternoon, giving you time to settle in before diving into temple life with a guided tour and a nourishing vegetarian dinner. As evening falls, immerse yourself in drum and bell rituals, Buddhist chanting, and a soothing singing bowl meditation. Take time to reflect, unwind, or explore the serene temple grounds before turning in for a restful night, recharged for the adventures ahead. Day 5: Start your morning the traditional way with a peaceful Buddhist dawn chanting ceremony, before tucking into a simple (yet delicious) temple breakfast. After returning your temple uniform and saying farewell to the monastery, a private transfer will take you back to Seoul – ready for your onward journey through Korea or flight home.

generalInfo: This is a captivating journey through South Korea. You can immers yourself in its rich history, vibrant culture, and breathtaking landscapes. Explore Seoul's iconic sites, such as Gyeongbokgung Palace, Insadong, Bukchon Hanok Village, and Gwangjan Market. Experience the charm of Yongin Folk Village and Suwon Hwaseong Fortress, and discover the ancient treasures of Gyeongju. In Busan, visit Haedong Yonggungsa Temple, Haeundae Beach, Bulguksa Temple, and Seokguram Grotto. From the colorful alleys of Gamcheon Culture Village to the bustling markets, South Korea offers a truly enchanting experience, leaving lasting memories of its vibrant culture and natural beauty.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Seoul. Private transfer from airport to hotel. Your guide will meet and welcome you at airport. Then transfer to hotel and help you check in. Rest of the day is free for leisure activities.

Seoul Highlights with Korean Hanbok Wearing Experience Embark on an unforgettable tour day in Seoul. Begin at Gyeongbokgung Palace, immersing yourself in royal history and marveling at its stunning architecture. Experience the vibrant atmosphere of Insadong, where traditional and modern blend seamlessly. Explore the quaint streets of Bukchon Hanok Village, stepping back in time as you admire traditional Korean houses. Indulge your senses at Gwangjan Local Market, known for its fresh produce and mouthwatering snacks. Finally, complete your day with a Korean Hanbok wearing experience, allowing you to embrace the beauty of traditional Korean attire and capture memorable photos. Get ready for an enriching journey through Korean culture.

South Korean Traditional Culture Trip. Today you will explore the captivating cultural landmarks of Yongin Folk Village and Suwon Hwaseong Fortress. Our first stop is Yongin Folk Village, where you'll be transported back in time to experience traditional Korean village life. Wander through its charming streets and marvel at the authentic hanok houses. Immerse yourself in cultural activities, such as traditional crafts and performances, and gain a deeper understanding of Korea's heritage. Next, we'll visit Suwon Hwaseong Fortress, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Explore the impressive fortress walls and architectural marvels, offering panoramic views of the surrounding areas. Learn about its historical significance and enjoy a journey through Korea's storied past. Join us on this captivating day tour to experience the rich cultural heritage of Korea.

Gyeongju Highlights Trip. Embark on a remarkable day tour from Seoul to Gyeongju via Korea Train Express (KTX) first class, and immerse yourself in the rich history of this ancient city. Start your adventure by visiting the Daereungwon Tomb Complex, where you'll marvel at the majestic royal burial mounds and gain insight into the Silla Dynasty. Continue to the iconic Cheomseongdae Observatory, an ancient astronomical observation tower, and appreciate its impressive architecture. Next, explore the picturesque Anapji Pond, surrounded by beautiful gardens and reflecting an enchanting atmosphere. After this memorable exploration, journey to the vibrant city of Busan, where you can delve into its bustling markets, picturesque coastlines, and rich cultural heritage. Upon you arrival, your local guide will escort you to hotel and help check in.

Discover the beauty of Busan and Gyeongju. Our journey begins at Haedong Yonggungsa Temple, an extraordinary seaside temple known for its stunning ocean views and ornate architecture. Experience a sense of tranquility as you explore the serene grounds. Afterward, we'll head to the lively Haeundae Beach, where you can soak up the sun, stroll along the sandy shore, and indulge in delicious seafood at nearby restaurants. Next, we'll venture to Gyeongju to visit two UNESCO World Heritage sites: Bulguksa Temple, a magnificent masterpiece of traditional Korean architecture, and the awe-inspiring Seokguram Grotto, home to an exquisite Buddha statue.

Explore The Vibrant Busan. Begin your adventure at the charming Gamcheon Culture Village, known for its colorful houses and winding streets. Lose yourself in the artistic murals, local art shops, and quaint cafes while immersing yourself in the village's unique atmosphere. Next, take in the scenic views of the coastline during a Songdo Cable Car ride, where you can admire the breathtaking panoramas of the city and the ocean. Afterward, venture to Jagalchi Fish Market, Korea's largest fish market, brimming with fresh seafood and bustling energy. Indulge in delightful street food and witness the lively auction scenes. Lastly, explore the bustling Gukje Market, famous for its diverse range of goods, from clothing to traditional crafts. Immerse yourself in the vibrant atmosphere and engage with local vendors.

Depart from Busan. Your private car, driver, and guide will be ready at your hotel lobby on the final day, ensuring a punctual departure to the airport. With their impeccable service, you can relax and enjoy a hassle-free experience. They will assist you with check-in procedures and accompany you to the correct security gate, ensuring a smooth and pleasant journey home, leaving you with cherished memories of your time in South Korea.

generalInfo:
South Korea is a dynamic country, steeped in culture, tradition and history, with vibrant cities, rich landscapes, friendly local people and staggering nature. Join this trip to immerse yourself in the contemporary culture of bustling Seoul, meditate and spend the night in an ancient temple, discover the beauty of Seoraksan National Park and explore the colourful markets of Busan. This, combined with the chance to taste some of the most underrated cuisine in the world, makes a trip to South Korea unforgettable.

One of Our Top Recommended Trips for 2026… Here’s Why K-Pop (and K-Pop Demon Hunters), kimchi, Squid Game… even Baby Shark: the global explosion of Korean culture (or hallyu) is one of the great cultural phenomena of our times. If you haven’t already, then now’s the time to visit South Korea and go beyond the headlines to explore a culture that everyone’s talking about, but few truly experience authentically - Sarah Puttnam, destination expert

dayInfo.description: The adventure begins in Seoul, the buzzy capital of South Korea. Time permitting, the leader will arrange a short orientation tour near the hotel. We can visit Gwangjang Market, one of the oldest food markets in Seoul, where local people meet after work to enjoy traditional foods and liquor. The market also sells vintage clothing and textiles during the day but comes alive in the evenings when unique foods such as bindaetteok, a popular pancake with makkolli, the traditional Korean rice wine, are served. Around 6pm, say annyeonghaseyo (hello) to your tour leader and fellow travellers, when we gather as a group to get to know each other and learn more about the adventures ahead. Your tour leader then ensures a big welcome by arranging a group dinner. Want more time in Seoul? Secure pre-tour hotel nights through your sales representative. Accommodation: Kukdo Hotel (or similar)

Today we enjoy a walking tour of Seoul. We first head to the Cheonggyecheon, an age-old canal in downtown Seoul that was filled with concrete in the 1960s but reopened in 2005 in its original state. We continue to Tapgol Park, the central point of the Korean independence movement in 1919. From here, we head to Insadong, the artisan neighbourhood where traditional teahouses and souvenir shops are lined up in a cosy, welcoming atmosphere. After, we visit Jogyesa Temple, one of the most beautiful temple complexes in the heart of Seoul. At Gwanghwamoon, admire impressive statues of Admiral Yi and King Sejong, men who played vital roles in Korean history. The next stop is Gyeongbokgung Palace. Built by the Joseon dynasty in 1394, this immense complex was the centre of power until Japanese occupation at the start of the last century. At the palace, we may see the changing of guards. Our last visit today is Bukchon Hanok Village, which is home to hundreds of traditional hanok houses from the Joseon dynasty. Please note, the order of these activities may change. Although not strenuous, the amount of walking today is considerable and fast-paced (we recommend comfortable walking shoes). Accommodation: Kukdo Hotel (or similar)

Today we visit Panmunjom, the only place on the peninsula where North and South Koreans can meet face to face. It was here the peace treaty was signed in 1953 and where both parties agreed on a Joint Security Area (JSA) in the middle of the border between the two countries, also known as DMZ (Demilitarized Zone). After a short briefing by US army personnel, we enter the JSA; here we visit Freedom House, the blue barracks sharing a conference room for talks between both North and South Korea, the visitor’s observation post and the Bridge of No Return. En route, we enjoy a traditional Korean dish for lunch. Due to government restrictions, this excursion is guided by a local JSA-specialised guide and not by your tour leader. The Panmunjom tour may be withdrawn at any time and, in such cases, this trip is substituted with visits to other key areas in the North-South Korea history, such as the Third Tunnel. We must also mention that some nationalities are not permitted to take part in the tour (at the time of writing this includes nationals from Afghanistan, Cuba, Iran, Iraq, Libya, North Korea, Pakistan, Sudan and Syria) and it will be more difficult to obtain permission for South Korean and Chinese nationals to join the tour. Strict rules are in place for DMZ tours and, as such, passport details must be provided in advance. For dual passport holders, please ensure you provide Exodus with the exact passport details you will be entering South Korea with (and will be required to carry on the day tour). During the tour, it is critically important you follow instructions from military personnel and guides. Please refer to the What to Take section of the Trip Notes for information on required attire for this trip. The Joint Security Area currently remains closed and could re-open at any time. Entry into the DMZ area itself is open and other key sites such as the Third Tunnel are still possible to visit. Accommodation: Kukdo Hotel (or similar)

Today begins with a private transfer (approximately three hours) to Gangneung on the east coast. In the heart of Gangwon Province, we visit one of the most picturesque culinary bases in Korea, where all the food is produced and processed naturally and according to centuries-old recipes; fermented food such as kimchi, red pepper paste, doenjang (bean paste) and fish sauce is stored and aged in clay vessels, sometimes for more than five years. Herbs are grown and harvested from gardens, and wild herbs collected from the mountains. Here we learn how bibimbap is made, a traditional dish of rice with vegetables, herbs, meat and several side dishes. We then lunch on this freshly cooked, healthy food. In the afternoon, we transfer to Sokcho, a lively coastal city that belonged to North Korea from 1945 until the end of the Korean War. Accommodation: Sea Cruise Hotel Sokcho (or similar)

On the beautiful east coast, the Seorak Mountains are the most famous in Korea. At the foot of the peaks is an enormous Buddha statue, which acts as a start point for a variety of trails between 2km and 10km (1.25mi and 6.2mi). The leader guides those who wish on an easy and short optional walk. A more leisurely option is to take a cable car to one of the mountaintops to enjoy fantastic views. Accommodation: Sea Cruise Hotel Sokcho (or similar)

We transfer (approximately four hours) to Andong by private minibus and visit the Andong Hahoe Village, where ancient traditions influenced by the teachings of Confucius are still alive. The inhabitants live in the same way their ancestors did, in simple houses for the common farmers and in richly decorated houses for the yangban (gentry). Accommodation: Park Hotel (or similar)

We transfer (approximately 2hr 30min) to Gyeongju by private minibus, stopping en route to visit the Dosan Confucian School. In the afternoon, we visit Tumuli Park, which has royal tombs dating to the Shilla dynasty. The numerous artifacts found in these tombs show the remarkable technological and cultural advancement of that period (600 CE to 900 CE). We also visit Cheomseongdae, the oldest existing astronomical observatory in Asia. The 362 stones used to build it represent the 362 days in the lunar calendar. Accommodation: Commodore Hotel (or similar)

Seokguram Grotto, which we visit this morning, was discovered by a postman sheltering from the rain. Inside the human-made cave, he found an astonishingly beautiful statue of Buddha, constructed during the Shilla dynasty. The grotto is now a Unesco World Heritage site. From here, we visit Bulguksa Temple, constructed in the same period. This afternoon, we visit the National Museum of Gyeongju, where we can relive the rich and advanced culture of the Shilla dynasty and see numerous archaeological findings. Our day ends with a stop at Anapji Pond, an artificial pond constructed in the royal palace grounds, before exploring Gyeongju Market area. Accommodation: Commodore Hotel (or similar)

This morning, we transfer to Haeinsa Temple (approximately three hours). It is one of the oldest in Korea and home to the Tripitaka Koreana, the most complete collection of Buddhist texts, engraved on 80,000 woodblocks between 1237 and 1248. Here we experience a strict Buddhist lifestyle and meet monks dedicating their lives to prayer and meditation. On entering the temple, exchange your own clothes for simple monk clothing and, after the initial introductions and opening ceremony, walk around the beautiful temple complex. After the vegetarian Buddhist dinner, we join a tea ceremony. Lights out at 9pm this evening, ready for our early wake-up. Please note, during our temple stay, the programme and order in which it runs can be subject to changes. Due to an inclined walkway at the temple entrance, it is recommended to take a small overnight bag in your main luggage to use for the overnight stay at the temple (main luggage will be stored and securely locked in the group transport for the evening) if you wish. Accommodation: Haeinsa Temple

We wake at 3.30am to participate in the first ceremony and meditation (please note this is optional). After breakfast at 6am, we depart the temple and transfer to Busan (approximately two hours). From the impressive Gwangalli Bridge, we can enjoy a breathtaking view of the Busan shoreline. We learn the tragic history of the Korean War (1950-1953) at the UN War Cemetery, then visit the Nurimaru APEC House, a wonderful location with gorgeous views over the ocean. We also visit Jagalchi Fishmarket, one of the largest markets of its kind, to see a dazzling array of fish. Here you can taste Korean sashimi before heading into the adjacent Gukje Market to shop for souvenirs. After dinner, enjoy an optional visit to the Busan Tower (387ft/118m high) for amazing night vistas! Accommodation: Crown Harbor Hotel (or similar)

This morning, we take a bullet train back to Seoul (approximately three hours) and transfer to our hotel. This afternoon is free for last-minute shopping or to perhaps visit the vibrant Hongdae university district. You may also like to spend your final evening in Seoul exploring the lively nightlife of the Itaewon neighbourhood. Accommodation: Kukdo Hotel (or similar)
Our adventure ends after breakfast and we begin our return journeys home. Of course, if you’d like to spend a little longer exploring, speak to your sales representative about extending your stay.

generalInfo:
Embark on a 9-day family adventure and discover the unique culture, history, and cuisine of South Korea. Our newest South Korea Family Tour promises to provide you with an unforgettable experience, filled with fun activities for all ages. Immerse yourself in Korea's rich cultural heritage and stunning natural beauty as you explore Seoul, Jeonju, Gyeongju, Golgulsa, and Busan. Enjoy exciting activities such as a taekwondo class, an overnight stay in a temple, and a scenic boat tour.

What's included?

-All accommodation during your tour. Stay at centrally located hotels, an overnight stay in a traditional Korean Hanok, and an overnight stay at Golgulsa Temple where you can live like the monks do.
-All transport within the tour. Use of public transport inlcudes a pre-loaded Korean T-Money Transportation Card, and private transfers will be used where needed including shuttle buses.

Check out our unmissable included activities for the South Korea family tour below:
Taekwondo Class (Seoul)
Namsan Tower Observatory (Seoul)
Gyeongbok Palace (Seoul)
Visit & lunch in Bukchon Hanok Village (Seoul)
Nanta Show (Seoul)
Jeonju Bibimbap cooking class (Jeonju)
Gyeongju walking tour (Gyeongju)
Chunmachong Ancient Tombs visit (Gyeongju)
Daereungwon Tumuli Park visit (Gyeongju)
Cheomseongdae Observatory visit (Gyeongju)
Tea tasting in traditional hanok (Gyeongju)
Traditional Korean meal (Gyeongju)
Golgulsa Temple Stay – including meditation sessions, chanting session, sunmudo training, Buddhist dinner and breakfast (Golgulsa)
Gamcheon Village visit (Busan)
Songdo Beach & Marine Cable Car (Busan)
Jagalchi Fish Market & BIFF Square visit (Busan)
Visit to Haedong Yonggungsa Temple (Busan)
Busan coast sightseeing boat tour (Busan)

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Seoul: Your South Korea family tour is about to begin! Once you have checked in to your hotel, your Adventure Leader will welcome you with a trip briefing and provide you with information about the exciting activities that await you. You will also receive essential tips on how to adjust to life in South Korea. Your first activity will be a taekwondo class, where you will learn the basics and work up an appetite. After the class, you can return to your hotel to relax. Later in the evening, you will have the opportunity to join your group for dinner or explore the area on your own. Regardless of your choice, you will all head to the Namsan Cable Car station and take a ride up to the Tower Observatory to witness breathtaking views of the Seoul skyline at night.

Seoul: This morning, you will board public transport to your first stop of the day, Gyeongbok Palace. At 10 am, you will witness the Royal Guard Changing Ceremony before proceeding to the hanbok rental store. Here, you can rent traditional Korean clothing before entering the palace. Take your time to explore the palace and its grounds as it is a worthwhile visit! For lunch, your Adventure Leader will take you to an amazing spot in the city - Bukchon Hanok Village. This village is filled with traditional Korean houses called hanoks, and you will have ample time to explore the quaint streets before moving on to the next destination. You will then visit Insadong, which offers a glimpse of traditional Korean culture, with time to explore the antique shops, traditional tea houses, and handcraft shops for some unique souvenirs. Tonight, you will attend a Nanta show! This non-verbal comedy show uses music to tell a humorous story about four chefs who have to prepare a wedding banquet in an hour. After the show, you will have some free time to explore Myeongdong at night.

Seoul: Today, you have a free day to explore Seoul as you wish. Your Adventure Leader can offer recommendations if needed. You might choose to explore more of the city, take a day tour to Nami Island, or visit Lotte World!

Jeonju: It's time to move on to the next destination of your South Korea family tour - Jeonju! You will travel via high-speed train (KTX), arriving in Jeonju late morning. After dropping your luggage off at the beautiful Hanok Village, you will head off to another exciting activity - a Korean Food cooking class in a city renowned for this traditional dish. Bibimbap, meaning "mixed rice," consists of rice topped with sauteed vegetables, kimchi, meat, and egg. After the cooking class, you will have some time to explore the streets of Jeonju's Hanok Village. There are plenty of stores, snacks, and cafes to discover - try to find your favorite! Tonight, you will check into your accommodation - a traditional hanok stay. You will spend the night in one of the beautiful traditional Korean houses and have free time to explore the area at your leisure.

Gyeongju: This morning, you will travel to Gyeongju via an express bus. Upon arrival and dropping off your luggage at the hotel, your guide will lead you on a walking tour of the city center, sharing the area's history. You will visit the Chunmachong Ancient Tombs, Daerungwon Tumuli Park, and Cheomseongdae, which is the oldest existing astronomical observatory in East Asia. Additionally, you will visit a 300-year old hanok for a tea tasting. This evening, you will enjoy a traditional Korean meal before heading to Donggung Palace for breathtaking night views of Anapji Pond. After a busy day, it's time to rest up!

Gyeongju/Golgulsa: You will have a free morning to explore Gyeongju on your own. Your guide can offer recommendations, particularly if you are interested in seeing the UNESCO Bulguksa Temple or the Woljeonggyo Bridge. In the early afternoon, you will board a private shuttle bus headed for Golgulsa Temple, where you will spend the night and experience a monk's way of life. Upon arrival, your schedule will follow the temple's daily routine, starting with an orientation that includes etiquette tips, meditation, communal work, and sunmudo training. You will then enjoy a traditional vegetarian Buddhist dinner before retiring to bed.

Busan: Get ready for an early start today as you awaken to participate in a morning meditation and Buddhist chanting session. Enjoy a final traditional Buddhist breakfast before you depart for your last destination in South Korea, Busan, on the KTX train. Upon arrival, head to Gamcheon Village to explore the cultural area and indulge in some local cuisine for lunch. In the afternoon, take a cable car ride to witness spectacular views of Songdo Beach. Afterwards, visit the Jagalchi Fish Market and trendy BIFF Square to do some shopping and savor Busan-style hotteok, a local delicacy. Transfer to your hotel and spend a leisurely evening exploring Busan at your own pace.

Busan: Begin your day by visiting the Haedong Yonggungsa Temple, the most beautiful temple in Korea that sits along the coastline - a rare sight as most temples are located in the mountains. In the afternoon, unwind at Gwangalli beach and enjoy the serene views. Relax on the sandy shores or dine at one of the many restaurants and cafes by the waterfront. As your South Korea family tour comes to a close, embark on a boat sightseeing tour of the Busan coast before enjoying your final free evening in the city. Ask your guide for recommendations to make the most of your time!

Farewell: I hope you enjoyed your South Korea family tour! As you check out of your hotel in Busan, you'll have time to reflect on all the amazing experiences you've had during your trip. From exploring bustling cities to immersing yourselves in traditional Korean culture, you've truly had a diverse and unforgettable adventure. As you take the KTX back to Seoul, you can reminisce about your favorite moments and start planning your next family trip. Whether it's exploring more of Asia or venturing to a different continent altogether, there's a world of exciting destinations waiting to be discovered. Thank you for choosing this tour and safe travels back home!

generalInfo:
South Korea has a rich cultural heritage which contrasts sharply with its ultra modern image of bright lights, big cities and industrial and technological advances. This 11-day classic group tour takes in the highlights of this intriguing country which many people will find pleasantly surprising.

Explore the bustling metropolis of Seoul with its high rise buildings and super efficient subway juxtaposed with the serenity of sites such as the grounds around what remains of the Gyeongbok Palace. Explore the impressive reproduction of local life in the Korean Folk Village which teaches you a little about Korean culture in the 18th and 19th centuries and enjoy panoramic views of the city from atop Seoul Tower.

Explore scenic Songnisan National Park, known for its excellent walking trails, and the famous Beopjusa temple which is home to a number of golden Buddhas and the largest Buddha in Korea standing at 33 metres high. Drive to Gyeongju, the 'museum without walls', an area of important archaeological interest where relics are being unearthed on a regular basis.

Discover the Tripitaka Koreana, a set of complete Buddhist scriptures in Haeinsa temple, a UNESCO registered site of historical importance and take a boat trip on Chungju Lake before departing for Samhwasa Temple for an authentic overnight stay. Dress the part and partake in the evening Buddhist ceremonies of bell-ringing and chanting mass and enjoy meals from the organic garden. Rise early for morning mass and to enjoy the remote sunrise vistas before heading to the DMZ for views into North Korea.

Return to Seoul via Mount Seorak National Park for a cable car ride to visit the Shinhuengsa Temple and choose to enjoy the relaxing hot springs. This interesting and varied group tour explores remote national parks, historical temples and bustling cities to give an excellent all-round South Korean experience.

dayInfo.description: Land in Seoul and transfer to the hotel for the next two nights. The remainder of the day is at leisure.

After breakfast, begin the Seoul city tour with a visit to Changdeok Palace, a UNESCO World Heritage site. Next, explore Gwangjang Market, known for Korean street food. Then, visit the National Museum of Korea, featuring a large collection of Korean art and relics. Afterward, head to COEX Mall and stop at Byeolmadang Library. End the day at N Seoul Tower on Mt. Namsan for views of the city.

Transfer to the Korean Folk Village located just outside Seoul. Discover the tastefully reconstructed traditional Korean village before continuing on to pretty Songnisan National Park which offers excellent walking trails. Visit the Beopjusa Temple which is regarded as one of the largest and most impressive temples in the country. After time here drive to Daegu via the expressway. (B)

After breakfast at the hotel, visit Daegu Yangnyeongsi Museum of Oriental Medicine and the historic Yangnyeongsi Market. Explore Seomun Market, a key market from the Joseon dynasty. Transfer to Gyeongju, the ancient capital of the Silla kingdom. Enjoy traditional tea at a local café, then visit Cheomseongdae Astronomic Observatory and Royal Tumuli Park, where you can enter one of the excavated royal tombs. Overnight in Gyeongju.

After breakfast, start a full day tour of Gyeongju. Visit Bulguksa Temple and the Seokguram Grotto, established in the 8th century on the slopes of Mt. Toham. The grotto contains a monumental statue of a sitting Buddha looking out to sea and it is considered a masterpiece of Far East Buddhist art. Drive along the pretty coastline to Guryongpo Port. (B)

Check out and transfer to Unmoonsa Temple (Buddhist Nun's temple) before proceeding to Busan, the second largest city in South Korea. Enjoy a half-day tour taking in Busan Tower on Mt Yongdusan with its observation deck offering stunning views of the city and beyond, the interesting Jagalchi Fishery Market and Nampodong Street. (B)

Drive to Mt Gayasan National Park and visit Haeinsa Temple which has an important Korean cultural treasure called Tripikata Koreana. Proceed to Andong, the best-preserved village in the country, visit Hahoe Village and proceed to Chungju Lake. (B)

Board a sightseeing boat and head out on the lake. Afterwards drive to Woljeongsa Temple for a unique temple stay experience. Upon arrival don your temple uniform and this evening attend the bell-beating ceremony along with chanting mass and a meditation course. Spend the night in a shared Korean-style room. There are no 'phones/TV's and bathroom facilities are separated for men and women. No alcohol is allowed. Overnight at the temple (there is a private room in the monastery OR a hotel option available for a supplement). (B)

There is the option to wake up at 3am for morning worship and to enjoy sunrise. After breakfast, transfer to Pine City Gangneung to visit the Chamsori Gramophone & Audio Museum. Transfer to Mt. Seorak National Park and enjoy a cable car ride to Gwongeumseong Fortress and a visit the Sinheungsa Temple. (B)

After breakfast transfer to Yanggu and visit the War Memorial Museum built to commemorate the sacrifice and heroism of those who fought in the Korean War. Explore the 4th infiltration tunnel dug by the North Korean Army and discovered in 1990 and the Eulji Observatory which sits about 1km from the military demarcation line. Transfer to Gapyeong to visit the Garden of Morning Calm Flower and Tree Park, which displays unique Korean Wild Flowers and trees in the garden located in a mountain valley. Return to Seoul for the afternoon at leisure, why not try a spot of shopping at Itaewon shopping District. (B)
Today is at leisure until you return to the airport for your onward flight (departure transfer not included). (B)

tourName: South Korea heritage and culture tour
generalInfo: Embark on an 11-day cultural odyssey through South Korea, exploring the vibrant metropolis of Seoul, the natural wonders of Jeju Island, the rich history of Gyeongju, and the serene beauty of Pyeongchang. Discover UNESCO World Heritage sites, indulge in traditional Korean culture, and bask in the stunning landscapes and culinary delights that Korea has to offer.

dayInfo.description: Seoul, South Korea: Welcome to Vibrant Seoul Arrival at Incheon International Airport Upon arrival at the world-renowned Incheon International Airport—awarded the world's best airport service quality by Airport Council International—you will be warmly greeted by our representative, ensuring a seamless start to your memorable journey. Transfer to Bustling Seoul Relax in comfort as you are transferred to Seoul, Korea’s vibrant capital city. Seoul is a dynamic metropolis, bustling with energy, deeply steeped in history, politics, economic growth, and cultural beauty, setting the stage for an unforgettable adventure. Relax & Unwind - Leisure Time Take advantage of free time to refresh at your accommodation or begin exploring Seoul at your own pace. Walk the charming streets, sample local cuisine, or visit nearby markets and cafes, setting a relaxed and personalized tone for your exciting trip ahead.

Seoul, South Korea: Royal Palaces & Traditional Korean Village Exploration Morning Pickup & Tour Kickoff Enjoy a delightful breakfast, and get ready as you're picked up conveniently from your hotel. Jogyesa Temple – Serenity in the City Start your day at the peaceful Jogyesa Temple, the chief temple of Korean Buddhism’s Jogye order, known for its serene ambiance, impressive lotus lanterns, and magnificent architecture. Gyeongbokgung Palace – Journey into Royalty Step into Korea’s grandest royal residence at Gyeongbokgung Palace (Deoksu Palace replaces Gyeongbokgung on Tuesdays). Marvel at its imposing gates, elegant pavilions, and royal gardens that hint at the opulence of the Joseon Dynasty.
